BodyCopy.p:
“Understanding the Possibilities: Captive Solutions for Optimizing Capital” is the theme for the Connecticut Captive Insurance Association 2015 Symposium on Captive Insurance in Connecticut planned for October 15, 2015, at the Sheraton Stamford Hotel in Stamford, Connecticut.
The agenda for this 1-day event is packed with presentations on a number of current state and federal issues and examples of solutions to captive operational problems. Presenters will include insurance regulators and experienced experts in the captive insurance industry. John Foehl, Captive.com and Captive Wire editor, will attend and provide reports from the symposium.
After a welcome and introduction, the morning opening general session is as follows.

li.p: "A National Perspective: The NAIC and Feds View of Captives" will feature presentations by Katherine L. Wade, insurance commissioner, State of Connecticut, and P. Bruce Wright, partner, Sutherland Asbill & Brennan LLP.

BodyCopy.p: Concurrent morning session topics are as follows.

li.p: "It's an Insurance Company: The Importance of How You Run Your Captive"
"Creative Captive Solutions for the Middle and Small Market Companies"

BodyCopy.p: The afternoon opening general session is as follows.

li.p: "Works of ART: Rationalizing Your Captive from Beginning to End" will be presented by Stephanie C. Mocatta, president, SOBC Corp., and Mark Allitt, director, advisory, KPMG.
"The Frontier of Insurance-Linked Securities: Bridging Captives and the Capital Markets"
"Captives as Effective Cost Management Tools for Health Care"

BodyCopy.p: The final general session of the event is as follows.

li.p: "When the Stakes are High: Solutions for Cyber and Terrorism Risks" includes presentations by Thomas Stokes, practice leader—Consulting Services, JLT Towner Insurance Management (USA) LLC; James McDermott, Alvarez & Marsal; and Arvind Parthasarathi, cofounder and chief executive officer, Cyence.

BodyCopy.p: The complete program and registration for the symposium are available.
